title: Standalone installation failed on Mac M1
body:
Hi @chubin, 
Thanks for the amazing project.

I tried the [standalone installation of cheat.sh](https://github.com/chubin/cheat.sh/blob/master/doc/standalone.md) on my Mac M1 machine, it failed with the following error:

```python
$cht.sh python read file
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/harshgupta/.cheat.sh/lib/standalone.py", line 17, in <module>
    import cheat_wrapper
  File "/Users/harshgupta/.cheat.sh/lib/cheat_wrapper.py", line 14, in <module>
    from routing import get_answers, get_topics_list
  File "/Users/harshgupta/.cheat.sh/lib/routing.py", line 15, in <module>
    import adapter.cheat_sheets
  File "/Users/harshgupta/.cheat.sh/lib/adapter/__init__.py", line 18, in <module>
    from . import *
  File "/Users/harshgupta/.cheat.sh/lib/adapter/question.py", line 15, in <module>
    from polyglot.detect import Detector
  File "/Users/harshgupta/.cheat.sh/ve/lib/python3.8/site-packages/polyglot/detect/__init__.py", line 1, in <module>
    from .base import Detector, Language
  File "/Users/harshgupta/.cheat.sh/ve/lib/python3.8/site-packages/polyglot/detect/base.py", line 11, in <module>
    from icu import Locale
  File "/Users/harshgupta/.cheat.sh/ve/lib/python3.8/site-packages/icu/__init__.py", line 37, in <module>
    from ._icu_ import *
ImportError: dlopen(/Users/harshgupta/.cheat.sh/ve/lib/python3.8/site-packages/icu/_icu_.cpython-38-darwin.so, 2): Symbol not found: __ZN6icu_6918AnnualTimeZoneRule8MAX_YEARE
  Referenced from: /Users/harshgupta/.cheat.sh/ve/lib/python3.8/site-packages/icu/_icu_.cpython-38-darwin.so
  Expected in: flat namespace
 in /Users/harshgupta/.cheat.sh/ve/lib/python3.8/site-packages/icu/_icu_.cpython-38-darwin.so
 ```

Other information:
- Python 3.8.5
- virtualenv 20.13.1

title: Performance
body:
I've found the performance long way out from the quoted 100ms. 

Even when using a local install a simple query takes 1.2 s

Wondering if this is an exception to the rule, and if it is do you have any pointers where to look.

Thanks!

title: Incomplete results from upstream repositories
body: It seems like latest updates from upstream repositories are available, e.g. if you search for `set` you don’t get all results from https://github.com/tldr-pages/tldr/blob/master/pages/common/set.md. Is this something that needs to be run manually?

title: Error 500 when searching for keyword
body: Internal server error is thrown everytime I try to search for keyword, e.g. `curl cheat.sh/~redirect`. Same thing happens on website and when using via `curl`.

title: cht.sh shell script doesn't work after curl update
body:
I have been facing this problem since I updated curl. After some analyze this issiue I ended up with ssl connection and certificate problem. I'm using cht.sh command from terminal. If you change the url in this shell script http://cht.sh (without ssl) instead of https, it's working as expected.
I think this issue comes from Let's Encrypt certs and curl fire up "SSL certificate problem". More info at https://letsencrypt.org/docs/dst-root-ca-x3-expiration-september-2021 and https://curl.haxx.se/docs/sslcerts.html

title: Instructions on how to install standalone on MacOS.
body:
I was struggling a bit with getting standalone to work on MacOS. Redis was not installed, hence the instructions were failing. Looking [here](https://medium.com/@petehouston/install-and-config-redis-on-mac-os-x-via-homebrew-eb8df9a4f298), I installed redis first:

```bash
$ brew install redis
$ ln -sfv /usr/local/opt/redis/*.plist ~/Library/LaunchAgents
$ launchctl load ~/Library/LaunchAgents/homebrew.mxcl.redis.plist
$ redis-cli ping
PONG
```

Next, the standalone install worked flawlessly.

title: Autocompletion on Bash on Mac not working
body:
Each time I'm doing a TAB, I see things like this:

```
-bash: _get_comp_words_by_ref: command not found
```

I can avoid it by catching the errors:

```bash
$ cat ~/.bash.d/cht.sh 
_cht_complete()
{
    local cur prev opts
    _get_comp_words_by_ref -n : cur 2>/dev/null

    COMPREPLY=()
    cur="${COMP_WORDS[COMP_CWORD]}"
    prev="${COMP_WORDS[COMP_CWORD-1]}"
    opts="$(curl -s cheat.sh/:list)"

    if [ ${COMP_CWORD} = 1 ]; then
	  COMPREPLY=( $(compgen -W "${opts}" -- ${cur}) )
	  __ltrim_colon_completions "$cur" 2>/dev/null
    fi
    return 0
}
complete -F _cht_complete cht.sh
```

Notice the `2>/dev/null` for both commands.

title: head cheat sheet prevents update-all
body:
When I've done update-all and try it again, it fails:

```bash
$ python3 lib/fetch.py update-all
/Users/mnott/.cheat.sh/upstream/late.nz
/Users/mnott/.cheat.sh/upstream/tldr
/Users/mnott/.cheat.sh/upstream/cheat.sheets
/Users/mnott/.cheat.sh/upstream/cheat.sheets
/Users/mnott/.cheat.sh/upstream/learnxinyminutes-docs
/Users/mnott/.cheat.sh/upstream/cheatsheets

ERROR:
---
fatal: ambiguous argument 'HEAD': both revision and filename
Use '--' to separate paths from revisions, like this:
'git <command> [<revision>...] -- [<file>...]'

---
Could not get list of pages to be updated: [Adapter: cheat (Cheat)]
/Users/mnott/.cheat.sh/upstream/RosettaCodeData
```

In order to get that printout, I've added

```python
    print(adptr.local_repository_location())
```

just at the top of 

```python
def _update_adapter(adptr):
```

into fetch.py. Now investigating further, I find that if I 

```bash
rm upstream/cheatsheets/head 
```

first, I can run the update.

Of course, I can rather

```bash
rm -rf upstream/cheatsheets && python3 lib/fetch.py fetch-all && python3 lib/fetch.py update-all
```

so that I keep the complete cheatsheet, but there should be a better way.

title: Add command option sub sheets
body:
Possible functionality to make really popular commands even more meaty

Curl cheat.sh/podman run

Would give specific sheets for a run option command, purely optional behaviour that would only exist for a subset of the most useful bash utilities

Absolutely love this repo, it is amazing work

title: Also use pager for normal queries (but skip paging when output is not to a terminal)
body:
I don't use `--shell` very much, rather ad-hoc `cht.sh <query>` in the shell. The paging that is used in shell mode would be helpful there as well, to avoid scrolling back in the terminal when there's long output.
The existing `do_query()` function that is used in shell mode looks like it can be a drop-in replacement for the duplicated `curl` calls, and with that we get paging for normal queries as well. (And this reuses any set session id as well.)
Some initializations need to be moved further up; they still don't run for `--help`, `--mode`, and `--standalone-install`.

title: algo.sh: a search engine for algorithms using cht.sh
body:
I know there exists [Snippet](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vscode-snippet.Snippet) extension for cht.sh; however, I wanted to give the project a user interface of a search engine. It is actually a GUI integration of cht.sh for visual studio and vscode. I mentioned cht.sh under the credits section of the documentation. If you have any suggestions regarding documentation (credits and such), or the project, please reply or contribute. 

[Github repository](https://github.com/Dj-Polyester/algo.sh-vscode)

[Visual studio extension marketplace](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=algo-sh.algo-sh)

title: styles-demo is inaccurate/out of date
body:
Calling `:styles-demo` appears to simply dump the file share/styles-demo.txt. It seems to be missing some styles and doesn't accurately demonstrate some styles.

Here's a screenshot of styles-demo:
![static-demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/808185/105504038-4c9a5f80-5c95-11eb-9e9b-4efb14439b4c.png)

Here's a screenshot generated with the small script at the bottom of styles demo. (In this case, I tested with `git-pull` and changed `head` to `tail` since the first five lines of the output were all comments)
![dynamic-demo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/808185/105504174-73589600-5c95-11eb-958d-07869c39ce90.png)

Two things of note:
1. the format of the comments on the rainbow_dash is different
2. the sas style is missing from the styles-demo output

Some thoughts on resolution:
* update shares/styles-demo.sh
* change `:styles-demo` to return all styles dynamically, using a representative command output
* change `:styles-demo` to be a query parameter so one could do `curl cheat.sh/git-pull?styles-demo` and the get dynamic output for all existing styles, like in the script

_Edit: FWIW, I'm on MacOS using [iTerm2](https://iterm2.com/) with a light background_

title: Zsh tab completion not working on Mac
body:
Hi,
I've installed tab completion script following the commands.
```
    $ curl https://cheat.sh/:zsh > ~/.zsh.d/_cht
    $ echo 'fpath=(~/.zsh.d/ $fpath)' >> ~/.zshrc
    $ # Open a new shell to load the plugin
```
However, even if I have ran `source ~/.zshrc`, when I type `cht.sh go/f`, the suggestion didn't show up.
Am I missing something? Thanks!

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24364830/100745973-09510c80-341b-11eb-9dae-566f9953abc3.png)

body: On the page [https://cht.sh/prolog/part(P,Xs,Xs,Xs)](https://cht.sh/prolog/part(P,Xs,Xs,Xs)), there is HTML code being shown in the response.

title: Replace polyglot with langdetect
body:
https://github.com/aboSamoor/polyglot depends on pycld2, which depends on PyICU, which needs C compiler and tons of stuff to build, because it [doesn't ship wheels](https://github.com/ovalhub/pyicu/pull/39#issuecomment-458000833).

The only `polyglot` feature what is used it language detection - https://polyglot.readthedocs.io/en/latest/Detection.html

This can be done with less sophisticated dependencies, such as https://github.com/Mimino666/langdetect

title: answers in wrong language
body:
Sometimes answers are returned in a different language from the one specified. e.g:

```bash
$ curl cht.sh/python/progress+meter  # correctly returns python [so/q/3160699]
$ curl cht.sh/python/progress+bar  # incorrectly returns java [so/q/19417246]
```
